intro: Hieracium wilczekianum subsp. romieuxii, commonly known as the Romieux's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
